title: Head of Operations Job at Glovo Nigeria
content:
Glovo - We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day. Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Operations

Job Location: Lagos
Department: Operations

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	This role is for a senior leader (Head of Operations) of Glovo’s operations team, which focuses on working with the Glovo team to support our couriers and partners to improve their operations and user experience around delivery. 
	As a Head of Operations in Nigeria, you will have the unique opportunity to help us:
	
		Couriers (Supply Ops): Improve delivery times, quality of service and overall satisfaction of couriers
		Partners (Partner Ops): Improve on key metrics such as preparation time, waiting time, and menu quality.
	
	
	
	We're looking for someone who has a mix of the:

	
		Operational excellence to get great work done
		Negotiation and collaboration skills are needed to bring out the best from our partners (Couriers or Retailers)
		Strategic, innovative and creative thinking is required to develop outside the box solutions
		Management skills and emotional intelligence are required to lead and inspire a team.
	
	


The Journey


	Lead a team of Ops Specialists, guiding them and helping them both to achieve their goals and to develop their skills
	Lead by example by being incredibly truth-seeking, making data-driven decisions, and setting high standards for the team
	Establish the monthly/quarterly goals of your cities and be responsible for their operational metrics, continuously monitoring their achievement
	Be able to perform any required analysis and provide actionable ideas to improve indicators and solve any possible problems in the cities of your region
	Support the Commercial team on operational issues, identifying areas for improvement and possible actions, always with a didactic and positive attitude
	Put yourself in the Glover’s shoes - understand who they are in order to execute the best possible outcome and choose properly the solution we are launching or testing
	Understand, deep-dive, and have a complete understanding of the local supply situation at all times
	Identify channels to source new leads and potential Glovers through both online and offline media
	Analyze daily, weekly, and monthly operation metrics with a macro view of the long-term success of the city/region
	Reassure that we provide the best-class experience for our couriers, fleet partners, and we are the platform number #1 of their choice
	Have a blank page for you to create! We don’t stick to a single playbook, and we expect you to build your own as the business and market evolve.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


	At least 7 years of experience 
	Minimum 3 years of management experience in a fast-paced, demanding role (big tech, investment banking, private equity or consulting)
	SQL proficiency is preferred
	STEM degree is preferred
	Combine day-to-day and tactical management with a strategic and long-term view
	You should be able to motivate and develop teams
	You should be able to get your hands dirty, be on the frontlines, rather than delegate tasks routinely
	Results-oriented, autonomous and efficient. Decisions taken should be driven by available data
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are required
	Strong project management skills are a must
	Strong organisational skills and delegation, ability to prioritize and multitask, work well under pressure, handle multiple issues simultaneously in a dynamic environment
	Demonstrate sound written and verbal communication skills.

title: Procurement Sourcing Specialist Job at Mikano International
content:
Mikano International is Nigerian company in the power generation, automobile, steel fabrication sectors. This company offers sales, maintenance, assembly and distribution of power generation products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Sourcing Specialist

Job Location: Ogba, Ikeja, Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsisbilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Contribute to the establishment of the Bidders List in accordance with the Approved Vendors Lists.
	Contribute to the selection, management and performance monitoring of Vendors.
	Prepare request for quotations/invitation to tenders for goods and services in line with, allocating budgets, quality and delivery targets.
	Develop and implementing strategies for procuring goods and services for the oil and gas industry.
	Prepare proposals, request quotes and negotiating purchase terms and conditions.
	Prepare and issue purchase orders and agreements.
	Inspect and evaluate the quality of purchased items and resolving shortcomings.
	Monitor industry trends to ensure cost-effective sourcing and procurement.
	Negotiate contracts with suppliers to ensure the best value for the organization.
	Monitor supplier performance to evaluate satisfaction and quality of services.
	Take responsibility for purchases in support of customer-related business processes or for internal use.
	Discuss defects and delivery problems with suppliers and negotiating refunds.
	Coordinating with operations, maintenance, warehouse and engineering to ensure proper scheduling and movement of goods and supplies.
	Analyze costs, negotiating contract details, and offering strategies and solutions to help manage costs on supplies and vendor services.
	Manage, direct, negotiate, and award complex high-value and unique acquisitions for goods and services.


Qualifications


	B.Sc in Supply Chain Management or Logistics
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in the same or similar role
	We experienced in procurement strategic sourcing


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV  to: careers@mikano-intl.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Business Development Executive Job at VURIN Group
content:
The VURIN Group is a diversified portfolio of businesses across various sectors of the oil and gas and infrastructure industries, in Nigeria and beyond, with the primary mission to establish, grow, and manage the most successful group of energy operations and support businesses, in terms of superior shareholder returns, business leadership, and contribution to society.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-Time
Industry: Oil & Gas

The Role
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a dynamic Business Development Executive to drive growth in the upstream and midstream oil and gas sectors.
	In this role, you’ll identify new business opportunities, compile bids, gather project data, and leverage your understanding of regulations and client operations to capitalize on early-stage opportunities.
	If you’re a strategic leader passionate about driving growth and building strong industry connections, join us!


What you’ll do


	Identify, qualify, and secure business opportunities, coordinating business generation activities.
	Assist in the development and implementation of Business Development and sales strategies.
	Assist in the development of budgets and sales plans.
	Understand clients’ needs and offer solutions and support, responding to clients (existing and prospective) enquiries and requests for proposals (RFPs. RFQs, etc.).
	Collaborate with sales and leadership to secure, retain, and grow key high graded accounts.
	Create informative presentations, presenting and delivering information to potential clients at client meetings, industry exhibitions, trade shows, and conferences.
	Manage external relations and correspondences with industry stakeholders (governmental & non-governmental) such as NAPIMS, NIPEX, DPR, NCDMB, PETAN etc. 
	Translate innovative client insights into value-creating business plans. 
	Prepare high-impact presentations and proposals to clients promoting companies’ brand and protecting position. 
	Monitor the status of live contracts and purchase orders to advise clients correctly when required. 


What we are looking for
Education:


	Bachelor’s degree in business administration, marketing, or any related discipline.


Experience:


	At least five (5) years of experience in similar role, with a strong network within the industry.
	Knowledge and Proficiency in:
	Oil & Gas Industry, Standards, Projects, and Regulations
	Industry services marketing
	Lead generation and prospect management
	Industry local content regulations
	Bids and Tender preparations
